title: "explanation be helpful..." strange connected monoline script
content:
Does anybody know about this strange font? Or it is just lettering?  
Thanks in advance.

Ramiro.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [samplito.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/typophile.com/files/samplito.jpg) | 68.65 KB |

 [‹ Benetton logo geometric sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/typophile.com/node/32433 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) italic "passion for climbing" script - Flash {Mike F, Rainer} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/typophile.com/node/32426 "Go to next forum topic")
author: RamiroE

comments.content:
First of all, I think it looks like it is a font, in spite of the fact that it has two different l’s, for example. Those differences could be ligatures. The only similar font I can think of is [Quattr’occhi](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm/sku/RE10222) from 2Rebels. The font looks like it was designed on an ’Etch-a-Sketch’ toy, and so does your sample.

- Mike Yanega

It also resembles Gareth Hague’s [’Civility’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Civility). In fact, it resembles it quite strongly, except that it is a vertical script, with a different ’a’ type, among other things.

- Mike Yanega

I’m finding other similar fonts, like [’Echelon’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/virusfonts/echelon/) from Virus and [’Chube’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035526/http:/www.identifont.com/similar?95K) from Lee Fasciani, but they are less similar than ’Civility’.

- Mike Yanega
